channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: During Pelicot Trial, Avignon’s Ramparts Give a Platform to Denounce ‘Rape Culture’
item.description: A feminist collective, the Amazons of Avignon, has been plastering the walls of the city with testimony from the trial of the 51 men who were convicte...

item.title: CFPB sues JPMorgan, Bank of America over alleged Zelle fraud
item.description: "Zelle became a gold mine for fraudsters, while often leaving victims to fend for themselves," the CFPB said.

item.title: Pakistan Faces Resurgance of Terrorism
item.description: Political instability, dwindling public support and economic constraints are eroding the costly gains that the country made in combating militancy aft...

item.title: For Syria’s Economy, the Way Forward Starts With Sanctions Relief
item.description: Years of strife ruined the energy sector, battered the currency and strangled growth. The West must ease financial controls to help the economy, exper...

item.title: Yemeni Missile Lands in Tel Aviv
item.description: The Israeli military said several people were slightly injured after its air defenses failed to intercept the projectile.

item.title: Yemeni Missile Lands in Tel Aviv
item.description: The Israeli military said several people were slightly injured after its air defenses failed to intercept the projectile.

item.title: Musk Expresses Support for Far-Right Party in Germany’s Election
item.description: It was not the first online intervention by Elon Musk, the entrepreneur and adviser to Donald Trump, on behalf of once-fringe anti-immigrant parties i...

item.title: Troy Masters, Pioneering L.G.B.T.Q. Journalist, Dies at 63
item.description: He was at the helm of several influential publications, notably Gay City News in New York City and, since 2017, The Los Angeles Blade.

item.title: Despite missing deadline, Congress avoids government shutdown by passing spending bill without Trump’s debt ceiling raise
item.description: Republicans, keen to dodge a shutdown, decided to only introduce a one-vote spending package.

item.title: Merck-AstraZeneca breast cancer drug reduces risk of death by 28% in patients diagnosed early, clinical trial shows
item.description: About 87.5% of patients treated with the drug were alive after six years, compared to 83.2% who received a placebo.

item.title: Senior U.S. Diplomats Meet With Governing Militias in Syria
item.description: The U.S. officials in Damascus are also looking for signs of Austin Tice, a missing American journalist, as well as other U.S. citizens.

item.title: Crypto giant Tether invests $775 million in Trump-friendly video service Rumble
item.description: Tether's move to buy a large stake in Rumble signals its ambitions to expand both its technological and political ambitions.

item.title: Google Proposes Fix to Solve Search Monopoly
item.description: The search giant’s proposals included allowing flexibility for companies and consumers in choosing a search engine.

item.title: Party City to wind down operations, fire employees, CEO says
